fuzzing_params.Constraints: 2 <= nums.length <= 10^5, nums[i] is either -1 or in the range [1, 10^9].

problem_info.title: 3357. Minimize the Maximum Adjacent Element Difference
test_examples: Example 1: Input: nums = [1,2,-1,10,8] Output: 4 Explanation: By choosing the pair as (6, 7), nums can be changed to [1, 2, 6, 10, 8]. The absolute differences between adjacent elements are: |1 - 2| == 1, |2 - 6| == 4, |6 - 10| == 4, |10 - 8| == 2.
Example 2: Input: nums = [-1,-1,-1] Output: 0 Explanation: By choosing the pair as (4, 4), nums can be changed to [4, 4, 4].
Example 3: Input: nums = [-1,10,-1,8] Output: 1 Explanation: By choosing the pair as (11, 9), nums can be changed to [11, 10, 9, 8].
